title: 103_hr2662
content:
The "Business Improvement Act of 1993" establishes business activity targets for small businesses under the Small Business Act. The Administrator of the Small Business Administration must consider contracts awarded to program participants before the Act's enactment as contracts awarded for the purpose of meeting business activity targets. Additionally, procurement procedures are outlined in the Act. SEC. 3. PROCUREMENT PROCEDURES.

To facilitate small business participation goals, agencies can use restricted competition or price preferences for contracts with socially and economically disadvantaged small businesses. This authority is effective until September 30, 2000.

SEC. 4. ELIGIBILITY OF PAST DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM PARTICIPANTS FOR SECTION 8(a) CONTRACT AWARDS. SEC. 4 amends the Small Business Act to allow contract awards to small businesses owned by disadvantaged individuals who have completed the Program Participation period. It specifies eligibility criteria for competitive and sole source awards. SEC. 5 amends Section 8(a)(1) of the Small Business Act to eliminate competitive contracts and remove subparagraph (D). SEC. 6 ensures continued access to business opportunities. Section 8(a)(3) of the Small Business Act is amended to require competition for contracts to furnish products or services to a participating agency if certain conditions are met. This includes having offers from at least 2 eligible small businesses owned by disadvantaged individuals, performing similar contracts under the same program, and the current contractor graduating from a development program before the solicitation is issued. The Small Business Act requires competition for contracts to furnish products or services to a participating agency under certain conditions. This includes having offers from at least 2 eligible small businesses owned by disadvantaged individuals and the current contractor graduating from a development program before the solicitation is issued. Additionally, the head of a participating agency can restrict competition for a contract to small businesses owned by socially and economically disadvantaged individuals upon request. Eligibility for contract awards includes subcontracting a percentage of the contract value to small businesses in the developmental stage of the minority small business and capital ownership development program. The Small Business Act requires competition for contracts to furnish products or services to a participating agency under certain conditions. The head of a participating agency awarding a contract must ensure that follow-on contracts for the same products or services are awarded under the same authority. The term "participating agency" refers to any Federal agency, and "small business" is defined as a business concern with not more than 1500 employees. SEC. 7. STUDY OF DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM PARTICIPATION TERMS BY INDUSTRY SECTOR; SUSPENSION OF DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM GRADUATIONS. The Small Business Act is amended to authorize a short-term study on program participation terms by industry sector for small businesses. Additionally, the suspension of development program graduations is extended for small businesses participating in certain programs or activities. The Small Business Act is amended to allow small businesses participating in certain programs to continue until final regulations are issued or their eligibility expires. SEC. 8. COMPLIANCE WITH BUY INDIAN ACT.

Federal agencies contracting with the Small Business Administration under section 8(a) of the Small Business Act for goods or services from economically disadvantaged Indian tribes are considered compliant with the Buy Indian Act.

SEC. 9. UNIFORM PROCEDURES FOR CONTESTING STATUS OF CONCERNS.

Amendment to the Small Business Act establishes uniform procedures for contesting the status of small businesses owned by socially and economically disadvantaged individuals.
